key_points: Hurricane Ida causes devastating impacts across Mississippi and Louisiana, raising the death toll to four.
In Mississippi, a highway collapse due to the storm resulted in two deaths and at least 10 injuries.
An alligator attack in Louisiana floodwaters leads to a missing 71-year-old man.
New Orleans experiences widespread power outages, compounding the heatwave's effects on residents.
Residents face severe conditions, lacking electricity and tap water, and relying on shared resources.
Authorities and Entergy express uncertainty about the timeline for power restoration, hinting at up to three weeks.
Louisiana Governor John Bel Edwards commits to delivering assistance amidst slow recovery efforts.
Over 6,000 national guard members from multiple states are mobilized for rescue and relief efforts.
Ida made landfall as a category 4 storm, causing extensive damage and leading to flash flooding and tornadoes across several states.
President Biden and federal officials coordinate with state and local authorities to provide storm assistance.
